No Longer in Denial About Grim Outlook, Investors Drive Market DownThe signals leading to this moment were hard to ignore.
More than 1.5 million people sought state unemployment benefits last week even as businesses reopened.

Top Military Official Apologizes for Role in Trump Photo OpThe photo op started a reckoning in the military. “I should not have been there,” said Gen. Mark Milley, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff.
Defying Trump, Senate Panel Moves to Strip Bases of Confederate NamesThe committee vote sets up an election-year clash with President Trump on the issue amid a rapidly building national outcry.
‘A Slap in the Face’: Black Veterans on Bases Named for ConfederatesPresident Trump has vowed to block efforts to remove Confederate names from military bases.

Video Shows Chicago Officers Lounging During LootingA congressman says security video from his campaign office shows police officers relaxing while stores were vandalized. Here’s the latest on the protests.
Is Antifa Instigating Unrest? Arrest Records Cast Doubt on Trump ClaimsThere is scant evidence that loosely organized anti-fascists are a significant player in protests.
How New York’s protest leaders are taking on the establishment: They’re young, charismatic and drawing huge crowds.
Mr. Biden paused at his mother’s casket after delivering her eulogy in 2010. Pool photo by Susan Walsh
Georgia Havoc Raises New Doubts on Pricey Voting MachinesExperts had warned Georgia about its over $100 million voting system, saying paper ballots were simpler and safer.
G.O.P. Platform, Rolled Over From 2016, Condemns the ‘Current President’The party’s platform includes more than three dozen unflattering references to those in power at the White House.

Louwenda Kachingwe, the owner of the Hatch, is known as Pancho. “The logical thing would just be to shut it down,” he said at one point. “But in this case, it’s about the people.” Jim Wilson/The New York Times
